column5: ''The Hill - Hobbiton across the Water'' by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]].]]

column1: '''Hobbiton Hill''', usually called simply '''The Hill''', stood to the north of the town of [[Hobbiton]].<ref>{{FR
column2: Part}}</ref>  [[Bag End]] was tunneled into this hill by [[Bungo Baggins]].<ref>{{H

column1: The earth removed in excavating Bag End was ''shot'' over the edge of the sudden fall in the hillside onto the ground forming the [[Bagshot Row]]; it became the gardens and earthwalls of the other dwellings.<ref>{{HM
